etymology.description: semantic: 糸(糸) (mì, "silk") + phonetic: 敏(敏) (mǐn, "quick/agile") = elaborate silk -> complex; numerous
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 糸(糸) (mì, "silk") suggesting something elaborate or industrious with 敏(敏) (mǐn, "quick/agile") implying multiplicity or complexity. This connects to the idea of something being complex or numerous, as elaborate silk textiles often were.

examples.chinese: 会议上讨论的问题繁多(會議上討論的問題繁多)。
examples.pinyin: Huìyì shàng tǎolùn de wèntí fánduō.
examples.english: The issues discussed at the meeting are numerous.

examples.chinese: 古书中的文字繁复(古書中的文字繁複)，读者需细细品味(讀者需細細品味)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔshū zhōng de wénzì fánfù, dúzhě xū xìxì pǐnwèi.
examples.english: The texts in ancient books are complex, and readers must savor them carefully.

examples.chinese: 生活中的琐事繁多(生活中的瑣事繁多)，却给人以温暖的记忆(卻給人以溫暖的記憶)。
examples.pinyin: Shēnghuó zhōng de suǒshì fánduō, què gěi rén yǐ wēnnuǎn de jìyì.
examples.english: The trivial matters in life are numerous, yet they leave people with warm memories.
